actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 161.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 161 â€” "Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 20) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Consumer Gas-fired Instantaneous Water Heaters"; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 35) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Waste Emissions Charge for Petroleum and Natural Gas Systems: Procedures for Facilitating Compliance, Including Netting and Exemptions";and providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 14) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2025 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2034."

Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 276L, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the British-American Interparliamentary Group: Mrs. Kim, Mr. Meuser, Mr. Aderholt, Mr. Smucker, Mr. Cole and Mr. Kean.

Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 276d, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Canada-United States Interparliamentary Group: Mr. Huizenga, Chair.

actions-list.header: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 3003, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Co-Chair.

Pursuant to 36 U.S.C. 2302, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the United States Holocaust Memorial Council: Mr. Kustoff, Mr. Bacon and Mr. Miller of Ohio.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. LaMalfa to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 25.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Earl L. "Buddy" Carter to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
